intro: Tetratheca preissiana, commonly known as the yellow sandblow, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are borne in clusters and are highly attractive to pollinators such as bees and birds. Tetratheca preissiana is well adapted to sandy and rocky soils, making it a common sight in arid and semi-arid regions of southern Australia.
